intro: Phacelia fastigiata, commonly known as the spiked phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open grasslands and woodland edges. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Phacelia fastigiata is also valued as a nectar source for bees and other pollinators.
